results.title: United Nations at work
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the work of UNRRA and later the International Children’s Emergency Fund providing food, clothing and medicine for children in war-devastated areas. The film tells the story of three Polish children, orphaned by war and living under extreme conditions of poverty. Relief is provided by UNRRA, but with the disbandonment of this organisation, supplies are cut off. UNICEF is established by the UN General Assembly and once more food and medical supplies are brought to the needy children of the world.

results.title: Uniroyal Australia
results.brief_description:
A non-narrated and detailed look at the entire process of tyre-making at the Uniroyal plant in South Australia. Indicates the testing process as well as showing other products made at the Uniroyal plant - polyurethane moulded car fascia panels, seats, armrests and loungeroom furniture.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Unions: putting you in the picture
results.brief_description: Designed to inform the migrant worker of the basic working of trade unions, and how they can become more involved in union activities. Shows the historical development of trade-unions in Australia and explains the functions of the members, delegates, organisers, branches and the ACTU. Contains some scenes in b&w.

results.title: Union street
results.brief_description: Union Street is a street just like any other, situated opposite the train line and underneath the flight path. None of the residents get along with each other particularly well, they just go about their daily business in isolation from the activities occurring next door. All this changes when the Armstrong-Taylors decide to renovate, acting as the catalyst to community involvement. The microcosm of the neighbourhood acts as a commentary on the changing face of Australia as the different cultural backgrounds of the individual households interact. Narrated by Andrew Denton.

results.title: Union maids
results.creator_credit: Julia Reichert, Miles Mogulescu, James Klein and New Day Films
results.brief_description: A stirring history of three women’s experience in labor organisation in Chicago in the 1930’s, told through interviews, interspersed with archival newsreels and period photographs of stop-work meetings, working conditions, picket lines and fights with the police. Raises issues surrounding sexism and racism in union organising. The three women are Kate Hyndman, Stella Nowicki and Sylvia Woods. Based on the book entitled “Rank and File” by Alice Lynd.

results.title: Union local
results.creator_credit: John Barnwell and Louis De Rochemont
results.brief_description: How Union 342, a trade union of industrial machinists, contributes to the security and well-being of American citizens. Shows the structure and activities of a union: duties of union officers; handling of grievances; collective bargaining; wage and work negotiations; and other labor-management relations.

results.title: Union at work: this is TWUA
results.creator_credit: Rosemarie Hickson, Lawrence Rogin, Albert Hemsing and Textile Workers Union of America
results.brief_description: The official story of the Textile Workers Union of America. Working through 800 locals, involving a membership of 450,000, the union carries out an extensive program of work bringing many benefits to its members. Filmed in the mills, on the picket lines, in union halls and in the homes of members, the film not only underlines the benefits of union membership but also stresses the rights and obligations of working people everywhere. Narrated by Joseph Julian.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Russ Mayberry, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.

results.title: UNICEF: the first forty years
results.brief_description: Presents a comprehensive history of UNICEF since its formation in 1946 to the present day. Catalogues its worth in the developing countries and indicates its success in various projects to improve the health, nutrition and social development of millions of people. No other credits available.

results.title: Unhook the stars
results.creator_credit: Nick Cassavetes, Panos Nicolaou, Rene Cleitman and Hachette Premiere
results.brief_description: Gena Rowlands portrays a middle-aged widow whose life is on the threshold of change. Her daughter has just left home on less than amicable terms and her married son is totally absorbed in his own life. When Mildred is approached by her neighbour (Marissa Tomei) to mind her young son, JJ, after her abusive husband walks out, she immediately consents. Initially quiet and tentative, JJ gradually gains confidence as the two develop a strong bond which provides them with the support they lack from their own families. The film explores the evolving relationship between Mildred and her two children, contrasting it to the unconditional friendship she shares with JJ. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Marisa Tomei, Gerard Depardieu and Jake Lloyd. Edited by Petra Von Oelffen. Photographed by Phedon Papamichael. Written by Nick Cassavetes and Helen Caldwell.
